traits.personality: He watches over companions as if they were a litter of newborn cubs. He does not show it openly â€” but he positions himself between danger and the weak without thinking.
traits.ideal: Glory is remembrance. To be remembered is to resist erasure. Every battle must mean something â€” his name must echo in story long after his bones bleach in the sand.
traits.bond: He walks so the memory of the First Land does not die. The weight of a fallen pride lives in every step.
traits.flaw: He is slow to trust outsiders. Respect must be earned in sweat and blood. You do not simply enter a pride by standing near it.

backstory.short: Before the Temporal Compression, his homeland breathed with mythic air. The horizon was wider. Spirits walked the surface of things. Then the world hardened. Matter thickened. What moved like wind became stone-bound. His pride faded â€” some into legend, some into the petrified ruins that scholars now mistake for ancient monuments. He held form. Not because he was strongest â€” but because his will refused to dissolve.

chapters.title: The First Land
chapters.subtitle: Before the Compression
chapters.text: Long ago, his homeland was not like the world is now. The air was lighter. The horizon wider. Creatures moved as song. Spirits walked at the surface of things. There was no barrier between the mythic and the physical â€” they were the same substance, breathing together.

chapters.title: The Temporal Compression
chapters.subtitle: The Fall
chapters.text: Then came the shift â€” not a war, not a disaster. A hardening. The world compressed. Matter thickened. What once moved like wind became stone-bound. What once sang in the air fell silent. His pride did not all survive the transition. Some faded. Some became legend. Some petrified into monuments that scholars now mistake for ancient ruins.

chapters.title: He Held Form
chapters.subtitle: Why He Survived
chapters.text: He endured â€” not because he was strongest, but because his will would not dissolve. His rage anchored him to reality when reality itself was rewriting. He carries oral history that no book records. He remembers things that, to the modern world, never happened.

chapters.title: A World Too Small
chapters.subtitle: Now
chapters.text: Now he walks a world that feels smaller than it should be. He recognizes shapes in ruins others don't. He sometimes stares at stone and sees motion. He treats mountains like former living things. He does not rant. He is steady. Grounded. A survivor of the hardening of the world.

chapters.title: The Core Question
chapters.subtitle: What drives him
chapters.text: Does he believe the world fell once and it is done â€” or that the world is still falling, just slowly enough that no one else can feel it? That answer determines how he rages. And what he's really fighting for.

traits.personality: Small frame. Quiet steps. Sharp tongue. Sharper blades. She teases her friends, mocks her enemies, and does not differentiate much in tone â€” only in outcome.
traits.ideal: She doesn't believe in ideals. She believes in hers. Loyalty like a war oath. Everyone else? Disposable.
traits.bond: Her ill-gotten gains support her family. She takes contracts. She finishes them clean. She never leaves witnesses if they threaten her circle.
traits.flaw: If there's a plan, she'll forget it. If she doesn't forget, she'll ignore it. She trusts instinct over strategy.

backstory.short: Born in the muted grey of the Shadowfell, Raven learned early that the world does not protect you â€” you protect yourself. She found work as a hired blade, not out of cruelty but necessity. Her family needed coin. She provided it, clean and efficient.

traits.personality: Small in stature, enormous in presence. Her curiosity is insatiable â€” she will touch everything, ask about everything, remember everything. Her laughter is genuine; her silences are calculating.
traits.ideal: Knowledge without application is just hoarding. She studies the boundary between life and death not out of morbidity, but because she believes something important lives there.
traits.bond: Her spellbook contains pressed flowers, margin notes in three languages, and a spell she hasn't been able to cast yet. The people she travels with have become, unexpectedly, something she would cross swamps for.
traits.flaw: She occasionally forgets other people cannot fly, hide instantly, or talk to mushrooms â€” leading to plans that only work if you're her.

backstory.short: A curious fairy who left the wild groves to study at Strixhaven's Witherbloom College, where the boundary between life and death is not a wall but a membrane. She pokes at it constantly.
